decision_conditions: The proposal, by reason of the loss of a retail unit within the primary shopping area of the Yiewsley/West Drayton Town Centre and the use proposed, would erode the retail function of the area, harming the vitality and viability of the centre. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policies DMTC 1 and DMTC 2 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (January 2020) and Policies 2.15 and 4.8 of the London Plan (2016).

In the absence of any details relating to noise and odour extraction or mitigation the development would constitute an unneighbourly form of development harmful to the amenity of nearby residents, by reason of odour and noise. The development is therefore contrary to policy DMTC 4 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (January 2020).

The decision to REFUSE planning permission has been taken having regard to all relevant planning legislation, regulations, guidance, circulars and Council policies, including The Human Rights Act (1998) (HRA 1998) which makes it unlawful for the Council to act incompatibly with Convention rights, specifically Article 6 (right to a fair hearing); Article 8 (right to respect for private and family life); Article 1 of the First Protocol (protection of property) and Article 14 (prohibition of discrimination).

The decision to REFUSE planning permission has been taken having regard to the policies and proposals in the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part 1 (2012) and Part 2 set out below, including policies for London consolidated with alterations since 2011 (2016) and national guidance.
description: Change of use from retail (Use Class A1) to restaurant (Use Class A3)
